name: Alice's Turkey Day Light Rolls
author: Jeff
summary: I'm sure these rolls were the reason for the original Thanksgiving! Mom stopped making them years ago and I wondered why until I got the recipe. Plan ahead, they're worth the effort. Enjoy.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon melted shortening, or as needed
directions: Stir milk, 4 1/2 tablespoons shortening, sugar, and salt together in a bowl
Pour water into a bowl and sprinkle yeast over the top
Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes; stir
Stir milk mixture into yeast mixture until smooth
Beat 2 1/4 cups flour into yeast mixture until smooth
Gradually stir in remaining flour until dough comes together
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead until dough is smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes
Place dough in an oiled bowl, brush with melted shortening, cover the bowl with a clean towel, and set in a warm place to rise until doubled in volume, about 2 hours
Punch dough down and form into 24 rolls
Place rolls on a lightly greased baking dish, cover with a towel, and let rise until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes
